intro: Gynoxys paramuna, commonly known as the Mexican beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces bright red, fleshy berries that are a striking feature of its appearance. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. Gynoxys paramuna is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
